html:
Best Collaboration

Reformation x HOKA Mach 6 LS Monogram

Pros

  • Chic colors
  • Comes with extra laces
  • 100% recyclable

Cons

    Let’s be real, Hoka shoes are a lot to look at. With this Reformation collab, the brand made the chunky, comfy sneaker even more fun, thanks to exciting colorways.

    Sizes: 5-11

    Colors: Savy Red, Eggnog Shortbread, Gray Rainy Day

    Customer review: “They are so comfortable! The color is so pretty. I have like five or six different pairs.”

    Best Overall Walking Shoe

    HOKA Clifton 9

    Pros

    • Comes in wide
    • Lightweight

    Cons

      One of the most recommended walking shoes, loved by both Broe and Tuliamuk, these come with a balanced cushion and are one of the lightest models you can get. Not to mention, they come in a sizable so many color options.

      Sizes: 5-12

      Colors: 22 options

      Customer review: “From day one, they have fit well, don’t rub at all, and are extremely comfortable! I am a HOKA convert now. They are totally worth it!”

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Plush Padding

      HOKA Bondi 8

      Pros

      • Available in wide
      • Breathable mesh

      Cons

      • Some reviews say toe area is too small

      The chunkier, the better. The plush cushion elevates your experience, so you might just feel like you’re walking on clouds.

      Sizes: 5-12

      Colors: 22 options

      Customer review: “I love these shoes almost as much as I love my child. They have completely eliminated all pain from my arthritis and literally put a spring in my step. I feel like I’m walking on a marshmallow cloud.”

      Comfortable Commuter

      HOKA Transport

      Pros

      • Easy to get on
      • Balanced
      • Water-resistant

      Cons

      • One of the heavier models
      • Some reviews say they are loud

      If you’re not up for tying laces, the Transport is the pair for you. Perfect for those who live in the city, they were made with transportation in mind.

      Sizes: 5-11

      Colors: 7 options

      Customer review: “I love them so much I bought another pair in black. Love the elastic laces, the Gortex uppers, and the durability of Vibram. Transports can accommodate various sock thicknesses with ease. As soon as they were delivered today I opened up the box and put them on!”

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Stable and Sturdy

      HOKA Gaviota 5

      Pros

      • Stabilizing
      • Best for wide feet

      Cons

      • For those without wide feet, some reviews say they can cause blisters
      • Not waterproof

      According to Broe, these are ideal for those with wide feet and one of HOKA’s most stable shoes. Their combination of stability and plush foam makes for a sneaker that has the best of both worlds.

      Sizes: 5-12

      Colors: 10 options

      Customer review: “This is my fifth pair of Gaviotas. I have tried many other brands of high-end running and walking shoes, and nothing compares to the quality and comfort of this shoe.”

      Stream-Lined Stride

      HOKA Arahi 7

      Pros

      • Stable
      • Good for running

      Cons

      • Need to break in
      • Some reviews say they are narrow

      If you prefer a more streamlined style that still provides stability, go for the Arahi 7. Loved by many, it’s a great choice for walking.

      Sizes: 5-12

      Colors: 10 options

      Customer review: “I was reluctant to try HOKAs because of all the hype, but when I finally did, they felt amazing. They are the most comfortable sneakers I have ever had.”

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Everyday Versatility

      HOKA Kawana 2

      Pros

      • Balanced
      • Heel tab allows for easy on/off

      Cons

      • Only 4 color options
      • Some reviews say they are too big

      A do-it-all sneaker, the Kawana 2 is perfect for all kinds of activities, including walking. You will love just how versatile these are, all while having the right amount of cushion.

      Sizes: 5-11

      Colors: Black/Black, White/Nimbus Cloud, Vanilla/Sandstone, Black/White

      Customer review: “The balance of the shoe is amazing. I was a Nike lover, but now I am switching to HOKA!”

      For the Adventurous

      HOKA Challenger 7

      Pros

      • Balanced
      • Good for trails
      • Lightweight

      Cons

      • Some reviews say sole is on thinner side compared to other models

      These may be marketed for trail running, but they are ideal for walking, too. No matter what terrain you’re on, you can rely on these to be balanced and comfortable. They’re great if you’re in rockier areas but equally as nice for city dwellers.

      Sizes: 5-12

      Colors: 13 options

      Customer review: “This shoe is like a trusty sidekick for your feet, ready to tackle any adventure you throw its way. I like how it feels lightweight and the cushioning feels like you’re running on clouds.”

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Multi-Tasking Runner

      HOKA Mach 6

      Cons

      • Geared towards running so might not be preferable for some

      The lightest pair on the list, these walking shoes are also great for running. They’ll take you from your run to brunch, all while keeping you comfortable and supported.

      Sizes: 5-11

      Colors: 6 options

      Customer review: “The shoe is extremely light weight and so comfortable! Well cushioned with lots of stability and support. I’ve already bought a second pair. I’ve finally found the PERFECT shoe for all of my foot issues!”

      Workout Wonder

      HOKA Solimar

      Pros

      • Balanced
      • Good for running
      • Comes in wide

      Wear them walking, running, and working out, the Solimar is balanced and made to last you miles. A perfect shoe for everyday.

      Sizes: 5-11

      Colors: 7 options

      Customer review: “They didn’t disappoint. I love the light weight of the shoe, as well as the comfort and ease of slipping my feet into them.”

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Meet the Experts

      • Bekah Broe is the senior product director of performance at HOKA.
      • Aliphine Tuliamuk is a professional runner and HOKA NAZ elite athlete.

      Why are HOKAs Ideal for Walking?

      Every pair of HOKAs has a different combination of their technologies. According to Broe, “a cushioned midsole, our Active Foot Frame™, and the MetaRocker™” all work together to provide a unique experience for the walker, depending on the model. Since people want different things out of their walking shoes, HOKA has a lot of different options that allow consumers to be able to find a pair that suits their individual needs best.

      Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

      Will HOKAs Last for Long?

      Yes, but the timing will be different with how often you wear them, how long you wear them, and the level of care you put into them. The terrain you’re walking on also plays a part. On average, though, you might need to replace them between 250-400 miles. “If you’ve noticed any initial discomfort, uneven wear patterns, balding tread, fraying or splitting, it might be a great time to invest in a new pair of footwear,” says Broe.
